topic.title: GuiScrollView and <ScrollContainer>
topic.p: GuiScrollView is the base class of all controls that with a <HScroll/> and a <VScroll/>. <ScrollView/> is a ready-to-use container control that automatically shows scroll bars when content takes more spaces than the container itself.

topic.title: ViewSize
topic.p: This property represents the size of the visible part.

topic.title: ViewPosition
topic.p: This property represents the position of the visible part. Components of ViewPosition are non-negative. When users scroll towards down or right, the position becomes larger.
This property could be assigned to change the position, which could cause scroll sliders move automatically.

topic.title: ViewBounds
topic.p: This property is the combination of ViewPosition and ViewSize.

topic.title: HorizontalScroll and VerticalScroll
topic.p: These properties return the <HScroll/> and the <VScroll/> of the container.

topic.title: HorizontalAlwaysVisible
topic.p: The default value for this property is true.
When this property is false, the <HScroll/> is not visible when the width of the container is large enough to display the content.

topic.title: VerticalAlwaysVisible
topic.p: The default value for this property is true.
When this property is false, the <VScroll/> is not visible when the height of the container is large enough to display the content.

topic.title: ExtendToFullWidth
topic.p: The default value for this property is false.
When this property is true, the width of the container is always kept large enough to display the content.

topic.title: ExtendToFullHeight
topic.p: The default value for this property is false.
When this property is true, the height of the container is always kept large enough to display the content.
